availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William G. Jones (Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, teacher, farmer, and justice of the peace)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, teacher, farmer, and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Son of Strother John and Ann. S. Jones. Married to Rebecca S. Jones. School teacher in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Farmer in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in 1860. Justice of the peace in Muhlenberg County in 1863.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 217; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 19; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 2; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Court House Precinct 3, p. 12; KYR-0001-029-0506.
